page.title: 02Coln St. Aldwyns
page.content: {Coln St.Aldwyns}is a picturesque Cotswold village.In the village there is a shop, a post office, a public house and about forty houses. The houses are traditional in design made from stone and roofed with stone.Some of them were built in the 16th century. Coln lies on Akeman Street, a Roman road. There are indications that a community flourished in Coln during Roman times; Roman coins have been found regularly and there are traces of the foundations of a villa. Sadly there are very few children in Coln for the houses here are very expensive and cannot be afforded by families with young children.Some of the houses are only used at weekends.
